definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise

sentences.english: He was caught by an avalanche and was seriously concussed.
sentences.chinese: 他碰到雪崩，受到严重的脑震荡。

sentences.english: To prevent avalanches , Park Rangers and Ski Slope managers do what?
sentences.chinese: 为了防止雪崩，公园看守者们和滑雪场经理们做什么？

sentences.english: A snowslide may make an everlasting love story, but even the snowslide cannot ensure Eternity.
sentences.chinese: 除非有雪崩，但雪崩也不能保证永恒。

sentences.english: A snowslide may make an everlasting love story, but even the snowslide cannot ensure Eternity.
sentences.chinese: 除非有雪崩，但雪崩也不能保证永恒。

sentences.english: Rescue workers rushed to the site.
sentences.chinese: 营救人员赶往雪崩地点。

sentences.english: If it was chaotic, each avalanche could swamp the brain.
sentences.chinese: 如果大脑是混沌的，每一次雪崩都能使大脑变成沼泽。

sentences.english: Love may last forever except in a snowslide , but even snowslide cannot ensure Eternity.
sentences.chinese: 除非有雪崩，但雪崩也不能保证永恒。

sentences.english: Love may last forever except in a snowslide , but even snowslide cannot ensure Eternity.
sentences.chinese: 除非有雪崩，但雪崩也不能保证永恒。

sentences.english: Landslides and avalanches, they report, were among the most common.
sentences.chinese: 山体滑坡和雪崩也是鸟儿们最常见死亡原因。

sentences.english: The avalanche crashed down the mountainside.
sentences.chinese: 这雪崩轰然一声落到山边。

sentences.english: A pile of books avalanched out of the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 一堆书从书架上雪崩似的掉下来。

sentences.english: Such avalanches may also be what triggers lightning.
sentences.chinese: 触发器闪光可能就是发生了这种电子雪崩。

sentences.english: This sudden shift destabilises the dunes and triggers avalanches.
sentences.chinese: 这一突然的改变使沙丘变得不稳定并引发雪崩。

sentences.english: There are threatening avalanches and ice falls that protect the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 雪崩和落冰好象都在保护这山一样。

sentences.english: The avalanche whelmed the small mountain village.

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
